sqlMap.sql: id, a.name, a.birthday, a.educationEnumId, a.major, a.university, a.position, a.title, a.mobilePhone, a.tele, a.workplace, a.cardTypeEnumId, a.cardNo, a.email, a.contact, a.address, a.zipCode, a.retirementEnumId, a.professionalBound, a.picture, a.genderEnumId, a.politicalEnumId, a.homeAddress, a.workDuring, a.majorWorkDuring, a.majorDirectEnumId, a.parttimeJob, a.workCaplityStrategy, a.workCaplityPolicy, a.workCaplityMarket, a.workCaplityConstruct, a.workCaplityQuality, a.workCaplitySupervision, a.workCaplityCost, a.workCaplityProjEnd, a.workCaplityProjEsta, a.workCaplityStandard, a.workCaplityTrademark, a.workCaplityRisk, a.workCaplityDataAnalys, a.workCaplityOthers, a.lastUpdateTime, b.description as educationdesc, c.description as cardtypedesc, d.description as retirementdesc, e.description as genderdesc, f.description as politicaldesc, g.description as majordirectdesc
sqlMap.select:
select
distinct
,
from expert a, enumeration b, enumeration c, enumeration d, enumeration e, enumeration f, enumeration g where a.educationEnumId = b.enumid and a.cardTypeEnumId = c.enumid and a.retirementEnumId = d.enumid and a.genderEnumId = e.enumid and a.politicalEnumId = f.enumid and a.majorDirectEnumId = g.enumid
and (
)
order by $orderByClause$
limit $offset$, $rows$

and (
)
order by $orderByClause$
limit $offset$, $rows$

select
,
from expert a, enumeration b, enumeration c, enumeration d, enumeration e, enumeration f, enumeration g where a.educationEnumId = b.enumid and a.cardTypeEnumId = c.enumid and a.retirementEnumId = d.enumid and a.genderEnumId = e.enumid and a.politicalEnumId = f.enumid and a.majorDirectEnumId = g.enumid and a.id = #id:VARCHAR#
